• Breasted's "History of Egypt" (English)

If you fail to read a book, you may return and try again on another day.

choices.text:
Make a Language (Latin) roll to study

*The Pnakotic Manuscript*

failure.message: You fail to understand the Latin text.

choices.text:
Make a Language (French) roll to read

*Le Culte d’Aten*

failure.message: The French text remains unclear.

choices.text:
Make a Language (German) roll to read

*Die Goules*

failure.message: You struggle with the German text.

choices.text:
Use your phrase book to attempt to read

*Die Goules*

failure.message: You fail to comprehend the German text.

choices.text:
Spend an hour reading

*The Pharaoh’s Curse, A Novel*

failure.message: You fail to grasp the full meaning of the text.

choices.text:
Spend an hour reading

*Breasted’s History of Egypt*

failure.message: You fail to fully comprehend the text.

276.description: But what is that sound you hear? Terror clutches your heart.

277.description: You drink another day’s water ration, and stumble ahead. The rocks have sliced your fine leather shoes into ribbons. Your bleeding feet are unlikely to carry you much further. Then, suddenly, you see Alexandria in the distance! Salvation!

278.description: You make your way forward, despite the searing sun and your aching feet. Somehow you feel you are headed in the right direction.

279.description: You no longer can doubt it. You have wandered far to the south, far into the desert. Death from thirst may follow unless you can retrace your steps. You stand on a hill. Farther yet to the south, you seem to see palm trees. Should you go there, or perhaps try to find your way north?

choices.text: Examine the vision of palm trees
Try to retrace your path North
Try to retrace your path East?
Try to retrace your path West

280.description: There is toughened glass around the Karpathos Device.

281.description: You decide to wait out the closing hours hidden in the shadows of the museum. If you fail, you will be ushered out.

282.description: You understand four more hieroglyphs: 'Akhenaten,' 'tomb,' 'sunrise,' and 'secret.'

283.description: The winds have exposed skeletons of men, horses, and camels—perhaps victims of some ancient vendetta. A jeweled dagger catches your eye. You’ll be able to sell it in Cairo for $100—if you make it back! Drink another day’s water ration and choose a direction.

284.description:
"Contrary to speculation and rumor, the so-called Lost Pyramid of Akhenaten is hidden at Tell-el-Amarna, the new capital founded by that Pharaoh. It is disguised as a small burial pyramid for friends, courtiers, and their slaves. Somewhere within is held the secret of Akhenaten’s madness, but no secret entrances or chambers have ever been found."

You find a sketch of the tomb as known.

285.description: You discover an oasis! Your gamble pays off. Exhausted, you fall into the sweet, fresh water and drink your fill. Later, the inhabitants tend to you and, two days later, a party of traders takes you on the 2 day journey to Cairo.

286.description: Did you receive a ring as a gift in Athens?

choices.text: Show him the Ring of Power
Tell him you don't have the ring

287.description: The map is a flattened view of the pyramid at Tell-el-Amarna.

288.description: "Yes. I have one reference, a cryptic one." He takes a scrap of parchment from a drawer. "It says, 'Only one passage helps. Where evil waits, the gate opens where you go up to go down.'"

289.description: The book gives many tales of strange creatures crawling through the shadows, and tells of tomb-robbers throwing down their picks and running away. It also asks: on what could such subterranean horrors feed?

290.description: You see household paraphernalia, combs, and tools, all of gold and silver. An empty sarcophagus contains a placard explaining that when the lord died, his slaves were killed in order that they might continue to serve him in the Afterlife.

choices.text: Want to decipher the Egyptian hieroglyphs?

failure.message: You fail to decipher the hieroglyphs and move on.

291.description:
"Ah, yes, well, that book is actually called the *Book of the Undead*! These mummies are real, my friend. They must be burned like so much offal or manure to be destroyed. Surely you’ve smelled that odor around the city, and have seen the troops racing about. That is one secret of Cairo which no one—not even the British—dares speak of."

Why be alarmed? You’re safe enough, for the moment.

choices.text: Return to the university main entry

292.description: "No, the pyramid is not lost. It is, in fact, at Tell-el-Amarna. A small structure, but one with secrets yet unlocked."

293.description: You have evaded several of the guards and the Karpathos Device is in your possession, decide your next action carefully.

choices.text: Decide what to do with the Device

294.description: He drums his fingers, "I have something for you. Should you go to the pyramid, search where the mark is." He hands you a map. "Search on the east side. An opening must be there."

295.description: "Many have looked for another entrance. All have failed. One party, however, vanished without a trace!"

296.description: Jahark offers to provide you with critical insights and knowledge to help you during your journey in Egypt. His advice proves invaluable in understanding the region’s history and culture, particularly when exploring ancient sites and libraries. While he will not accompany you, his guidance provides permanent bonuses to your skills.

choices.text:
Accept Jahark’s advice

+10% to History, Archaeology, and Library Use for the rest of the game

297.description: "I’m sure that this passage refers to it, ‘A cursed key for a cursed box! The Top of Terror, it unlocks.’"

298.description: Looking at the information provided, you read about references to a “top,” and to a “door opening.”

299.description: Your once-firm steps have weakened. You are very, very weary. Have you wandered too far west? Can you return?

success.message: You find your way and continue.

failure.message: You fail to navigate. Try a POW roll.

success.message: Your inner strength guides you.

failure.message: Your eyesight suddenly blurs. You must now rely on your survival skills.

301.description: You've managed to escape with the Device. Now you must decide how to proceed.

choices.text: Proceed with your escape, go to 293.
Surrender to the authorities, go to 315.

302.description:
Amet Keh is in and will gladly see foreign visitors. “So honored to have you call,” he murmurs.

What do you wish to do? Examine the Karpathos Device? Ask that the Device be returned to Athens? Ask about Gliere? Or do something else?

303.description:
You're in section-L.

You go down the stairs until you come to a deep shaft. You dimly perceive that the passage continues on the other side of the shaft.

failure.message: You slip and fall to the bottom of the shaft.

choices.text: Use a rope to lower yourself down the shaft
Try to jump down the shaft (Jump roll)

failure.message: Your feet slip as you jump and tumble to the bottom of the shaft.

304.description: You have encountered a repulsive ghast. These creatures leap on long hind legs, with hideously distorted faces appearing as twisted mockeries of humanity. Their coughing, guttural wheezes and red, hungry eyes stare at you. Their claws and teeth are sharp, and they hunger for you.

success.message: You manage to keep your composure and are ready to fight.

failure.message: Your mind reels, but you remain ready to fight.

success.message: You manage to keep your composure and are ready to fight.

failure.message: Your mind reels, but you remain ready to fight.

success.message: You manage to keep your composure and are ready to fight.

failure.message: Your mind reels, but you remain ready to fight.

305.description:
You’re in section-K.

The stairs go up; large steps designed for large beings. Obscene drawings of foul creatures decorate the walls: entities with slimy open pustules for eye sockets, and covered in gaping mouths everywhere. In the drawings, they use captive humans for lewd pleasures, and perhaps for something more substantial: your shock requires a Sanity roll.

306.description:
The terrifying hound-like creature has found you! It is a Hound of Tindalos. These creatures are nearly impossible to fend off, as they move through the angles of time and space. You are likely facing your doom.

Make a Sanity roll and lose 1D3/1D20 Sanity points. If you go insane, logical action, such as using magic or using a magical item, is impossible. If you have the ring, it protects only the hand upon which it is worn!

If the hound is driven away, carry on with your activities and add +1D10 Sanity points as a reward for your success. But defeating a Hound of Tindalos is a rare and unlikely feat. If you fail, it is very probably ... THE END.

choices.text: If you survive, continue your activities.

307.description:
You’re in section-D.

There's no way you can jump up and grab the ladder now.

308.description:
You’re in section-A.

The corridor ends at a deep shaft. Notches can be seen in the side of the shaft.

309.description:
You’re in section-A.

It’s a dead end, and the stone is solid and unmovable. You should give up and slide back down.

310.description:
You’re in section-I.

Going down, you come to another staircase, sloping west. Going up, you climb back to the previous section.

choices.text: Go down the stairs to the west

311.description: The tomb, or whatever it was, simply couldn’t have consisted of these few rooms. It must be bigger.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

312.description: Whatever aura exists in this place, it is not one of blessings.

313.description:
You’re in section-I, at a junction.

A corridor goes west and then seems to slope down. Above, you see stairs heading up.

choices.text: Climb down the stairs to the east

314.description: You enter the office and see three men. They are worried and confused: one mutters that Amet Keh is unavailable.

failure.message: You fail to gather any useful information.
You fail to gather any useful information.
You fail to gather any useful information.
You fail to gather any useful information.

315.description: You come forward, turn yourself into the police and confess everything. The Karpathos Device is taken from you and you rot in a hellish sanatorium for a long time. Eventually you are released.

316.description: Amet Keh’s eyes narrow, "What do you really want? I have told you all I know."

317.description: You carefully examine the northern face of the pyramid, studying its weathered surface and ancient inscriptions. With enough time and the right tools, you might uncover something significant.

318.description: You enter through a curtain. An old woman looks up, her eyes wild. You offer a coin you find in your pocket and she tells you your future.

319.description: The night is numbingly cold, but you survive. In the morning, you can go to the pyramid or to the village. You can also try to get a ride to Cairo with a caravan if you like: if you succeed with a Luck roll.

choices.text: Try to get a ride to Cairo with a Luck roll

320.description: You can rent a car for a week. It is a rough drive upriver to Tell-el-Amarna; a massive late flood of the Nile has closed both the railway and the regular passenger ship that runs up and down the river. The trip takes exactly 48 hours each way.

choices.text: Hire a translator guide to go with you

322.description:
What’s behind the door makes you gasp. Amet Keh, the Curator, stands there completely immobile. His skin appears glazed, his eyes and face fixed in an expression of terror. The word, “Petrified!” escapes from your mouth, and something tells you that his mind still lives inside his paralyzed body. “How horrible!” you add.

“Yes,” one of the men says. “Something somehow did that to him. Who or whatever it was, also took the Karpathos Device.”

There is nothing to do. Go to any Cairo location on the Cairo Location Table.

323.description:
You’re in section-J.

A shaft with notches leads up to the previous section. Or you can take the stairs leading down.

324.title: TELL-EL-AMARNA
324.description: The village is quiet. A gust of wind picks up dust along the empty road. Here and there a face looks out from a doorway. You spot the pyramid, one much smaller and less imposing than the pyramids at Giza. A well-trod path leads to the pyramid entrance.

choices.text: Spend the night at the inn

325.description: As you lower yourself slowly down on the rope, you pass a mosaic of incredible brutality. Creatures covered with bubbling masses of boils are surrounding and devouring entities that look like headless stalks, which seem to scream for help.

choices.text: Panic and climb back up the rope
Try to get into the corridor that goes to the East
Continue down the rope to the bottom

326.description: You notice two things: Amet Keh is breathing more heavily than normal, and you hear someone in the room behind him.

327.description:
You’re in section-K.

You see a shaft heading down with notches in the walls that seem able to support you. If you continue, you must make a Climb roll.

choices.text: Head to the West along the shaft

328.description:
You’re in section-N, at the bottom of the stairs.

The shaft with handholds continues to the East.

choices.text: Ascend the stairs to the West

329.description:
You’re in section-E.

You’re on a steep slope. You can go down carefully or attempt to climb back up.

choices.text: Attempt a Climb roll to go back

failure.message: You slip and fall down the slope.

330.description:
"Examine it? Return it? Impossible," he laughs, leaning back in his chair. "The Karpathos Device is far too valuable, and its power is beyond your comprehension. It stays here."

You press further, but his demeanor changes. "As for Gliere," he says dismissively, "I have never heard of this person!" His eyes narrow slightly, and he gestures toward the door. "Now, if that will be all, I must ask you to leave."

He stands, escorting you toward the exit with a forced smile.

failure.message: You fail to convince him to reveal more.

331.description: It’s loud, but it works! An opening appears. If you have any accomplices, they suspect you have gone mad, and desert you. Let them go. You have always been alone in this struggle; you will not be deterred now.

332.description: By the way, first you have to jump over the pit.

failure.message: Your jump falls short, and you fall into the pit, injuring yourself.

333.description: You fall. You can barely keep from screaming. Landing with a thud, you suffer scrapes and bruises. This was a bad fall, but not your first. You get up and find any gear you were carrying.

334.description: You discover a faint outline in the wall that seems to indicate a hidden passage. Could there be more beyond?

335.description: The art here has an oddly naturalistic feel, quite unlike anything typically associated with Dynastic Egypt. There is something unusual about this chamber.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

336.description: Scattered among the books on Keh’s shelves are some ominously ancient tomes bound in suspect hides. He also seems to be doing his best to stand in front of the internal door in his office.

337.description: You approach the southern face of the pyramid, where the scorching desert winds have eroded much of the stone. With careful study, you might reveal something of importance hidden in the weathered surface.

338.description:
You enter the first chamber of the tomb. On a large placard, you see the plan of the tomb.

A sign in many languages explains that this tomb is of minor importance, holding only lesser luminaries and slaves of Akhenaten’s court. The chamber in which you stand was a ceremonial room for the blessing of the dead.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.
You find nothing of interest.

choices.text: Leave and go outside the pyramid

339.description: This was the slaves’ chamber. An empty sarcophagus stands in a corner. Multilingual placards summarize Akhenaten’s reign: they emphasize his break with tradition when he shifted worship to Aten, an early monotheism, which roused the wrath of the priestly orders. Akhenaten’s marriage to the beautiful Nefertiti was considered a marriage of opposites, since many thought Akhenaten’s elongated head a deformation. Storied excesses rumored about Akhenaten’s court are not confirmed nor denied. Some scholars suggest that Aten was not the god worshiped by Akhenaten, and that another god may have demanded the sacrifice of human slaves, as some carvings in this chamber imply.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.
You find nothing of interest.

choices.text: Go back and take the right passage

340.description:
The café is a good place to hear rumors. You’ll hear snatches of conversation for every hour you spend here, but what you hear depends on how well you understand what was said.

You can get a bonus if you know Arabic.

choices.text: Listen to rumors (you know some Arabic)

1-2.description: You hear rumors of local trouble, but nothing concrete.

3-4.description: You hear about strange goings-on in the city, but it’s unclear how reliable the information is.

5-6.description: You pick up some useful information about Cairo’s underworld.

7-10.description: You learn of a secret meeting happening soon at a remote location.

choices.text: Listen to rumors (you don't know Arabic)

1-2.description: You overhear idle chatter, nothing useful.

3-4.description: You hear rumors of local trouble, but nothing concrete.

5-6.description: You hear about strange goings-on in the city, but it’s unclear how reliable the information is.

7-8.description: You pick up some useful information about Cairo’s underworld.

9-10.description: You learn of a secret meeting happening soon at a remote location.

341.description: Early in the morning, the nostrils of the camels steam in the chill desert air. You consume welcome cups of strong coffee and milk. As the caravan moves out, you are mostly ignored. Once in a while someone shouts something, which you imagine refers to you, but you never understand the words. That night, wrapped in your loneliness, you sleep a little apart from the others. In the morning you wake with a start. The caravan has—perhaps accidentally?—left you behind.

342.description:
You overhear the following:

"The thieves have fled toward the Quattara Depression."
"The device is part of a mechanical idol of Aten, to be found in the desert."
"Akhenaten’s city is the future home of the device."

343.description:
You overhear the following:

"The device is really part of an ancient lock."
"It has been stolen by the cult of Aten to unloose some evil."
"Tell-el-Amarna is the site of the Lost Pyramid."
"Strange bands of nomads roam near the Quattara Depression."

344.description: Despite your thorough search, you find nothing of interest. Disappointed, you consider your next move.

choices.text: Head to the village of Tell-El-Amarna

345.description: On the wall is a message of welcome from the True Servants of Aten to the initiates into the secret rites of the 'One God of Gods.'

346.description: You ask what’s behind the door and Keh replies, "Nothing!" Somehow, you don’t believe him.

347.description: Maybe there is a secret door, you hope. Or are you being foolish?

348.description: You successfully jump the shaft, only to discover that the corridor beyond is a dead end. Behind you, on the other side of the shaft, a creature emerges into the glow of a patch of moss. You have encountered one or more of these repulsive creatures, which leap on long hind legs. Their hideously distorted faces appear like twisted mockeries of humanity. They emit coughing, guttural wheezes. Their red eyes are hungry looking, and their claws and teeth sharp.

349.description: The sand is disturbed, as though someone or something has been this way before.

350.description: Something about him teases your suspicions. What is it? You can try only one of the following rolls once:

351.description: Your rope snags and starts jerking out of your hands.

success.message: You manage to hold onto the rope and climb back up.

failure.message: You lose your grip and fall down the shaft.

352.description: After you’ve climbed down partway, you see that you’ll have to jump the rest of the way.

353.description: Your fall stops on a stone floor. You find yourself in a new section. You can't get back where you came from; there is just the long hallway in front of you. There are hieroglyphics along the wall here.

choices.text: Proceed through sections J to I to K

355.description: You hear more steps, and another ghast appears. The pair begin to prod you with the long hooked rods they hold, then they hook you, pulling you toward the lip of the pit.

356.description: This information can’t be correct. Slaves generally were buried with their master. This 'tomb' must be something else.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

357.description: Hmmm. Certain reliefs on the walls have sections chipped away, as if to remove a single repeated figure. Odd.

358.description:
You’re in section-E, at the bottom of the shaft.

You can climb up or head west.

359.description: The eastern face of the pyramid catches the early morning light, casting long shadows across the desert. The erosion here seems less severe, but the ancient stone may still hold secrets. With the right tools or insight, you could make a valuable discovery.

choices.text: Head to the village of Tell-El-Amarna

360.description:
The pyramid is certainly old, but not very impressive. Do you want to walk around it? You can spend one hour examining one of its four faces: North, East, South, or West. It takes one hour to study a face.

Or you can enter the pyramid by going to the tomb entrance on the western side, or return to the village of Tell-el-Amarna.

choices.text: Return to the village of Tell-el-Amarna

361.description: Your car (and driver) are gone! You have a few options to spend the night or try your luck at finding a way back:

choices.text: Spend the night at the village inn
Make a Luck roll to find a caravan to Cairo

362.description: They seem oddly protective of the door behind them.

failure.message: You fail to dash past them and are sent away.

363.description:
You overhear the following:

"Creatures inhabit the tombs. Feeding on human sacrifices brought to the tomb, these creatures guard the lower levels against interlopers."
"They cannot stand sunlight."
"They have the device which opens the door."

364.description: It is, of course, typical of the strange turns which Akhenaten’s court art took—turns which led to the priestly classes seeking the Pharaoh’s downfall.

choices.text: Move forward to the next chamber

365.description:
You overhear the following:

"The cult of Aten are deluded fools. They serve semi-human monsters."
"Bodies have been seen carried to the eastern side of the pyramid at Tell-el-Amarna."
"Amet Keh served the cult, but they may dispose of him."

366.description: With rope and a sharp knife, you may be able to throw an improvised grapple.

success.message: You manage to grapple into the stone wall and safely descend, but you knife and rope come lose and the last second, falling at your feet.

failure.message: Your attempt fails, and you fall down the shaft.

367.description:
You’re in section-C.

The long corridor ends in a shaft downward, or you can go back down the stairs.

choices.text: Go back East and down the stairs

failure.message: You can't hear anything unusual.

368.description:
You're in section-H.

The steps become more ornate here. You can continue down the ornate steps or ascend back up the worn down steps.

369.description:
You’re in section-F.

It is very dark.

370.description:
Keh moves aside, letting you open the door.

As you open it, you see a man smile wryly at you, and then his face seems to melt, changing into a bubbling mess, with a myriad of alien eyes staring hungrily from each bubble!

success.message: Despite the odds, you hold onto your sanity.

371.description: The corridor is slanted downward, and it is slippery.

failure.message: You slip and fall to the bottom.

372.description: One man blurts out, “We don’t know who took it. Some say the cult of Aten.” A second man snorts. “More likely some wealthy art collector paid to have it stolen.”

373.description: You have landed in a bowl-shaped chamber. You think you can hear the sound of movement, but you see nothing until you strike a match. You stand knee-deep in a stack or pile of something, and the smell of blood is strong. Near you, something moves spasmodically. Your hackles rise.

choices.text: Use the Black Amulet of Klaath to teleport

374.description:
The shopkeeper, a short man, is somehow familiar. He has a huge collection of phony artifacts and cheap pottery. In fact, there is a suspect air about this place. You can browse for an hour.

If you succeed with a Spot Hidden roll, you discover something important; if you fail, you return to the market.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

375.description: Leering at you in an unseemly fashion, the shopkeeper steps between you and the door and draws a knife. “Kaieeee!” he screams, “Aten!” You can draw your own weapon to fight, or you can try to evade him.

choices.text: Engage in combat with the shopkeeper

376.description: A man charges a few piastres to enter the tomb, taking change from a cigar box. Above him, a sign in five languages reads: 'A Tomb of the Court of Amenhotep IV (Akhenaten).' The entrance fee is small, but the decision to explore the inside or outside of the pyramid looms before you.

choices.text: Explore the outside of the pyramid

377.description: It is the smell of chemicals used for mummification.

378.description: Make a Persuade roll: if successful, you may learn more. Otherwise, she will say no more.

failure.message: She says no more and returns to her silence.

379.description: It opens. You have found the way, but a waft of superstition washes over anyone still with you. You must continue alone. With a final glance, your companions step back, unwilling to enter.

380.description: "Keh is dead—that’s all we can say. And the Karpathos Device has been stolen. We don’t know who or why."

choices.text: If you're finished, return to the museum entrance

381.description: The room is filled with tools used during Akhenaten’s reign. There's also a report on early Egyptian agriculture, along with a map.

failure.message: Nothing seems out of the ordinary.

382.description:
From the entrance, you gaze into a narrow corridor, which slants steeply down. A strange odor greets you.

As you explore the interior, you take a moment to make a map of the pyramid. You decide to painstakingly mark your current location on the map so you don't get lost. (You can click on the map to enlarge it.)

failure.message: You can't place the smell.

384.description: You can either rent a car to get to Tell-el-Amarna, or try to join a caravan to visit the Quattarra Depression.

choices.text: Rent a car to go to Tell-el-Amarna
Join a caravan to visit the Quattarra Depression

385.description: You are invited by your dinner partners to play poker. You're on a roll and win $17.

386.description: You make out the markings with great difficulty. They seem to be a warning to flee this tomb unless you want to meet 'something.' But who or what you would meet has been chiseled away.

387.description:
You overhear the following:

"Keh is dead. He had served his purpose."
"The device is merely the key to the door."
"A new upheaval comes on the first day of the vernal equinox."
"The Lost Tomb is not empty."

388.description: The passage runs through section-I to section-K.

389.description: "Mmmm … I see darkness, darkness. Oh! A foul creature lurks, holding a basket. A door opens ... something shiny glows. I see your face trembling in the darkness, and below ... I see… " She stops abruptly. "I can see no more." She falls silent.

390.description: Located on the western side of the pyramid, the tomb’s entrance has been modified for tourists. You see the vast expanse of the pyramid towering above, and a small dusty entrance below where tourists enter. The tomb beckons, but the area around the pyramid might also hold clues.

391.description: You are at a set of stairs. The stairs lead down or up.

392.description: You hear something moving down there.

393.description:
You’re in section-A.

You are at the top of stairs that lead to a corridor heading west. There is a slant above you.

choices.text: Check out the slanted shaft leading higher

394.description: The stairs lead down to another shaft, apparently deeper. A rope may get you down, or you can attempt to jump.

choices.text: Attempt to jump down the shaft

395.description:
You’re in section-D.

You’re at the bottom of a shaft, and the floor slopes to the east. There seems no way to climb back up the shaft you came from.

choices.text: Go east, passing another shaft and taking the stairs

396.description: "As you wish. I see darkness, and you alone. There is blood, blood. Now I see ice, as though the whole world has frozen. Now ... Oh! How horrible! No! No! I must stop!" She stares at you as though you are a monster and, gasping, ushers you out.

397.description:
You climb up and down the eastern face of the pyramid, examining the carefully cut stones and looking for who knows what. Then you see that one stone seems to have a tiny crack of space. You shove as hard as you can: it moves slightly. You have found the secret entrance!

With a litte time you will be able to move this stone. Or, maybe you could blow it up somehow?

failure.message: The stone moves slightly. Keep trying!

398.description: Something brushes past your face, startling you. You jump off the rope as a reaction.

399.description:
You’re in section-K.

At the end of the slope, you see a shaft down and, across the shaft, stairs leading up. You see what look like hand holds in the wall of the shaft.

choices.text: Climb back to the opening to leave the pyramid

400.description: You attempt to climb the slanted shaft. Succeed in a Climb roll to reach the top. Fail, and you slide down to the floor below, losing 1D3 hit points each time you fall.

failure.message: You slide down the shaft and take damage. Try again if you'd like.

401.description: You can see the passageway continues east.

402.description: It is a fight to the death!

403.description: You wonder if the wall is false. You can attempt to push through.

success.message: You manage to push through the false wall.

failure.message: You fail to move the wall. You can try again in half an hour.

choices.text: Go back the way you came

404.description: You stand at the base of the shaft. The walls are rough, and you think you can climb up with some effort.

success.message: You successfully climb up the shaft.

failure.message: You lose your grip and fall, injuring yourself. You remain at the bottom of the shaft.

choices.text: Go back the way you came

405.description: You sneak down the steps into a chamber unlike anything you've seen before. The lower walls are smooth, almost mirror-like, absorbing all light. The upper walls display reliefs of strange creatures fighting over an important prize. On the floor below, five tall figures with grayish skin and hollow eyes stand beside a short man, whose eyes glisten. In the shadows, long-legged creatures lurk. The scene fills you with dread.

choices.text: Make a Sanity roll for witnessing the scene

success.message: You manage to keep your wits about you, for now.

failure.message: You lose control slightly but manage to hold on.

406.description:
You slide down to section-M, landing at the west end of a corridor.

There seems to be no way back up.

success.message: You notice something that might help.

failure.message: You fail to find anything useful.

407.description: The bullets have no effect! The creatures grab at you, pulling at your skin. You hear the horrifying sound of your own flesh tearing. The last thing you see is an open mouth leering down at you, as you scream for blessed unconsciousness. It is ... THE END.

408.description: "Curator Keh’s material must not be disturbed. You must go."

choices.text: Make a Dodge roll to get past them

409.description: You see a terrifying vision where the world tilts violently. Tidal waves crash against every coast, obliterating cities and towns. The polar ice caps melt, and a permanent freeze grips what were once the middle latitudes. Floods, snow, panic, and death follow swiftly. For most of mankind, it is the end. But for other creatures, it is only the beginning.

411.description: The walls tell a bizarre story: strange ceremonies are presided over by a tall man with glowing eyes. In the background, there are distorted, kangaroo-like creatures bending forward as they gaze into open sarcophagi. The next section shows mummies rising from the dead and taking their place beside the odd animals.

412.description: A few mummies stand about as the ghasts deliver food to them from baskets.

413.description: You see handrails for a creature of immense size.

414.description: The daggers are finely balanced, and you find yourself tempted to play. If you play for an hour, you have a chance to win or lose the game. The crowd cheers you on as you attempt your throws.

1-3.description: You win the game, earning applause and a handful of piastres!

4-6.description: You lose the game. The daggers slip from your grasp, and you walk away with empty pockets.

415.description:
You are in section-B.

The dark and narrow passage leads in two directions, West and East.

416.description:
You’re in section-G.

You are at the top of a staircase. The stairs lead down and west, or you can go west from the top of the stairs.

choices.text: Go down the stairs and west
Go west from the top of the stairs

417.description:
You’re in section-F.

As you walk west or east, you feel liquid dripping down upon you. Touching your head, you pull back your hand to reveal a thick, red liquid. It’s blood.

418.description:
You are in section-B.

You enter a large, dimly lit circular chamber. Embedded in the wall is the Karpathos Device, glowing faintly with an eerie light.

choices.text: If it is on or before November 20

419.description:
You’re in section-O.

You are standing at the bottom of a shaft.

choices.text: Try climbing up the nearby shaft
Go to the large chamber to the west

420.description: You have no choice but to walk east.

421.description: The thunderous blast of the dynamite kills a few of the creatures, creating chaos in the chamber. You use this opportunity to escape from the pyramid.

choices.message: You successfully escape out of the pyramid.

422.description: You attempt to flee, dodging the monsters as they come at you.

success.message: You successfully dodge the monsters and make it to the climb.

failure.message: The mummies grab you before you can escape.

423.description:
You are in section-P.

A shaft leads down to another section, while across the shaft, you notice a glinting object catching your eye. You can leap across the shaft without risk to investigate the object. The corridor also leads back east toward the previous section.

choices.text: Leap across and investigate the glinting object

424.title: INEXPENSIVE ATHENS HOTEL
424.description: This fleabag hotel is not exactly clean and sanitary, but it is quiet.

425.description: A small silver mirror rests face down in the dust. You pick it up. As you look into it, an image forms. You see myriad tentacles, maws, and bizarre organs—the purpose of which you can only guess. You feel utter dread chill you to the bone.

success.message: You manage to hold on to your sanity despite the dread you feel.

failure.message: You lose control, dropping the mirror and fleeing in terror.

426.description:
You find yourself in section-H, a crypt with small alcoves meant to hold sarcophagi.

An image of Earth is cut into the stone wall, seemingly spinning. You feel an eerie presence surrounding the place.

success.message: You make an intriguing discovery based on your knowledge of the planet's rotation.

failure.message: You fail to decipher the meaning behind the image, but there may still be time to leave safely.

success.message: You make an intriguing discovery based on your knowledge of the planet's rotation.

failure.message: You fail to decipher the meaning behind the image, but there may still be time to leave safely.

427.description: The tram lurches, throwing an asp against you. It strikes!

428.description: You see a small shaft. Peering down, you can discern the bottom.

choices.text: Attempt an INT roll to inspect the shaft

success.message: You successfully notice something about the shaft.

failure.message: You fail to find anything useful.

choices.text: Drop down into the short shaft
Stand and observe the shaft for a while

429.description: There is movement and you need to be quiet.

failure.message: You fail to sneak past them and are spotted!

430.description: A creature appears before you! Its hideously distorted face and red eyes stare at you hungrily. Prepare for combat.

431.description: The mummies and ghasts attack, coming from all directions. You must decide what to do next.

434.description: As you slide down, you see the image of a shapeless yet undeniably alive 'congerie of protoplasmic bubbles' carved into the floor. Dangling from various openings on the monster are many human body parts, all very much alive.

435.description: You’ve broken through the wall and entered section-M.

436.description: The writing says, 'Welcome to the servants of Ghatanothoa.'

437.description: You are in the shaft and you can see twelve fine grooves in the wall. Nervousness sets in, and you think it's best to get out.

choices.text: Try to Jump back to safety

success.message: You manage to escape the shaft.

failure.message: Your pathetic hopping is no good. A panel slides across the top, sealing you in. Blades emerge from the grooves...

success.message: You manage to escape the shaft.

failure.message: Before you can reach the top, a panel slides across the opening, sealing you in. Blades emerge from the grooves...

438.description:
You’re in section-F.

The passage narrows, and if heading west, it emerges into a corridor that ends at a wall.

choices.text: Attempt an INT roll to find something

success.message: You successfully notice something.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

439.description: The limestone is soft here. With a knife, you can dig handholds and climb up.

success.message: You manage to climb up successfully.

failure.message: Your hands are worn out and can't hold on any longer.

440.description:
You’re in section-M.

There’s a wall at the east end. You can, if you wish, try to break through by making a STR roll.

choices.text: Attempt to break through the wall

success.message: You succeed in breaking through the wall.

failure.message: You fail to break through the wall. You can try again after some time.

441.description:
You’re in section-M.

There is a corridor leading East, or you can try to jump of the shaft and head West.

success.message: You succeed in the Jump roll.

failure.message: You don't quite make the jump.

442.description:
You’re in section-O.

There are steps and a downward-leading shaft.

choices.text: Jump over the shaft and continue west

443.description: You’re on a steep descent. To make it down, you must make a successful STR roll.

success.message: You made it down safely.

failure.message: You slip and fall down to the bottom.

444.description: The inn’s proprietors are fiercely aloof. To stay there anyway, you have several options:

445.description: Some of the implements resemble sacrificial items used in Druidic rituals.

446.description: You can scarcely believe your eyes! Worm-like things are beginning to curl around your feet. These are just scouts for a mass of crawling flesh grasping for food. The worms are making natural attacks, and your ring (if you have one) has no power against them. You must act quickly to escape!

choices.text: Attempt a Dodge roll to escape

success.message: You manage to dodge the worms and escape.

447.description: You stay the night. You wake groggily, as if drugged. The air is cold, and you feel as though you’re falling. When you open your eyes, you see only darkness.

448.description:
Your car is uncomfortable, but at least you’ll avoid the local folk, who seem none too friendly. When you awake, you are cold and stiff, but you feel ready for anything.

To explore the pyramid, or you can return to Cairo in 48 hours.

449.title: BREMEN HARBOR
449.description: Bremerhaven, Bremen’s harbor area, appears quiet in the cold air of early morning. Dense, icy fog hangs over the port.

450.title: BREMEN AIRPORT
450.description: A free shuttle runs between the airport and the harbor. It is cold and foggy; you were lucky to arrive before a landing was impossible.

choices.text: Take the shuttle to the harbor

451.description: You see a freighter at anchor in the harbor, apart from the others. Your eyes note the reinforced hull, and the silver wingtips coming from bulky tarpaulins on the deck—probably Dorniers stored in sections. You can’t read the banner hanging limply in the damp air, but it almost surely says "Starkweather-Moore." The twin stacks of the ship disappear in the low-hanging fog.

453.description: You decide to stow away. You can stash food and water, and find shelter, in any one of the following hiding places: Lifeboat, Cargo Hold, Lower Deck (Storage), Engine Room (Rear).

choices.text: Decide this is a bad idea

454.description: Decide whether you are in uniform, or not.

457.description: A raucous group of Brown Shirts are laughing about something. You make out the words "Fuhrer," "Triumph," and "Amulet."

458.description: There’s fear in this room, but of what? The Brown Shirts? You feel something strange is happening.

failure.message: You fail to notice anything unusual.

459.description: Found, you are brought before Captain Crawford. He is not interested in your motives or what you say. You are locked in a windowless room on the lower deck for many days. Food is brought to you. Just as you are giving up hope, the ship arrives in Antarctica.

461.title: DER FREISCHÜTZ INN
461.description:
You enter the smoke-filled public room. You’re greeted with boisterous talk, steins loaded with foamy beer, and a crowd of Brown Shirts; their red and black swastika armbands clearly visible in the smoky haze.

Rooms are available for the night. If you wish to do more here than sleep, you can try some actions. When you are done, you can leave the inn.

choices.text: It's not safe to stay here

463.description: You decide to cut your hair and pose as a sailor.

464.description: The Captain assesses your skills, but it's clear that you don't meet the expedition's requirements.

467.description: Hereafter, that inn will be dangerous for you. You find a mission house where you may sleep while you are in Bremen.

469.description: If you succeed with a Language (German) roll, you might overhear something important.

failure.message: You can't make out the conversation.

470.description: It is a black amulet of strange design. Notes in German accompany it.

success.message: You successfully decipher the notes.

failure.message: You fail to fully understand the notes, but you can find someone to translate them later.

471.description: He stares at you. "Sir, that tone of voice may serve you well in the boardrooms of New York, but this is my expedition. Good day!"

choices.text: Try to convince the Captain again
Wait a day and try something else

success.message: You hit the man and incapacitate him.

failure.message: You miss, and the man lunges at you with his knife.

474.description: They rise uneasily, wary at your approach. A man steps forward, saying, "Sprechen Sie Deutsche?"

choices.text: Respond if you have skill in Language (German)
If you don't know German, back off

477.description: A group of Brown Shirts are gathered around a box on their table. You notice the box resembles the case to the Sacred Black Amulet of Klaath. It’s incredible, but it could help you.

choices.text: Try to get a closer look at the box

478.description: He studies you for a moment and then swiftly draws a knife. You have a split second to react.

choices.text: Try to quickly pull out your gun

failure.message: You fail to dodge the attack. They grab you and pummel you with a vengeance.

479.description: A group of Brown Shirts cluster about a curiously shaped box.

choices.text: Get a closer look at the box

482.description: "Be off with you," he snarls. Feeling foolish, you meekly leave.

483.description: The Captain says, "Our sponsors are Mr. Starkweather and Mr. Moore. You must ask them if this expedition is for sale," he says. 'Good day.'

choices.text: Try to convince the Captain again

484.description: The man's associates back away and you grab the box and an attaché case. The man, knife in hand, struggles drunkenly to his feet. One of his friends is fumbling frantically for something he carries in a leather jacket.

choices.text: Attempt to exit with a Dodge roll

success.message: You make a lightning-like and decisive escape.

failure.message: You fail to escape, and they grab you, beginning to pummel you.

485.description: "What do you want?" His hostility is evident.

486.title: THE STEAMSHIP: THE DARK SEA
486.description: The gangplank is down. If you wait here and try to talk to the sailors, you might get more information. You can also decide to see the Captain or the expedition leader. Alternatively, you can attempt an INT roll once daily to uncover something significant.

choices.text: Wait and try to talk to the sailors
Go to see the expedition leader

failure.message: You learn nothing useful today, but you can try again tomorrow.

487.title: Captain's Hiring Process
487.description: The captain is hiring people who have 25% or better in the following skills: Electrical Repair, Mechanical Repair, Navigate, Operate Heavy Machinery, Pilot (Aircraft), and Survival. Qualify in one skill area, and you're hired for the trip.

choices.text: Qualify with Electrical Repair (25% or better)
Qualify with Mechanical Repair (25% or better)
Qualify with Operate Heavy Machinery (25% or better)
Try to fake your skills (Know (EDU) roll)

success.message: You successfully fake your skillfulness and are hired for the trip.

failure.message: The Captain sees through your attempt.

choices.text: You don't have the skills he is looking for

failure.message: You fail to persuade today.
You fail to charm today.

choices.text: If you’re Holt - Try Fast Talk

failure.message: You fail to fast talk today.
You fail to intimidate today.

489.description: With your successful Charm, you delight them by offering to publish the expedition’s work and to finance later research. The leaders leap at the chance. Of course, you can go to Antarctica! The Dark Sea sails Dec. 20.

490.description: You can attempt one INT roll per day. When you succeed, you may proceed further.

failure.message: You fail the roll, but you can try again tomorrow.

491.description: You can try one of the following rolls once per day until you succeed, or relax for a while.

failure.message: You don't find anything this time.
You don’t hear anything useful.
You can’t get a good read on the people around.
The Mythos reveals nothing new to you.

494.description: The sailors are uneasy about the weather and the polar trip. They say that the Captain ('Old Haddock') is hiring only crewmen with particular skills. If you decide to try to fake the skills needed for a journey into a dangerous environment, you can attempt a Know (EDU) roll instead of the specific skill roll required.

495.description: He looks at you somewhat surprised. "Sorry, I don’t really follow. I don’t have time to argue, sir. Excuse me."

496.description: If you shed your uniform, get a false beard, and pose as a sailor, you can try to blend in.

choices.text: Pose as a sailor and go to the sailors

497.description: Professor Eustace Blake is very busy coordinating the expedition. "Who are you? What do you want?" he asks.

choices.text: If you are not Professor Grunewald

498.description: Once per day, you may attempt an INT roll. When you succeed, you can proceed further.

failure.message: You fail the roll, but you can try again tomorrow.

499.description: "But you’re on active duty, from your dress. Do you have orders requesting appointment to this expedition?" Of course you don’t.

539.description:
As you turn to leave, the sergeant seems to remember something then hands over a piece of paper. Unfolding it, you recognize Gliere’s tiny, precise script. There is no date and no signature:

Dr. Louis Grunewald
Miskatonic University
Arkham, Mass., U.S.A.

Dear Louis

I fear it is too late for me. Though with the best of motives, the authorities foolishly apprehended me before I could accomplish destruction of the Karpathos Device, and thereby they have re-endangered the world. If, to prevent my further interference, the cult of Aten tries to murder me while I am trapped in this cell, I do not see how they can fail their purpose.

This letter, therefore, must convince you of the truth I tell and relate to you what must be done about it. You must do it or see that it is done, else our world is doomed.

Though our discussions have acquainted you with some of what I now write, you have never accepted my arcane conclusions. I beg you now to do so, at least for the length of this letter. What follows is the situation, as I understand it.

An Alexandrian-era sorcerer, one Ephegon of Karpathos, was reputed to have constructed a mechanism perfectly replicating the movement of the spheres. According to certain fragmentary evidences, this device was to be sent to Egypt, to agents of the notorious cult of Aten. The record is dim. Perhaps it was designed in Egypt and built in Kerpathos, but I digress.

Once installed in Egypt, the mechanism could be used in a great ceremony presaging the end of the world. It would somehow align the forces of nature with the metaphysical powers of an unnamed, exceedingly evil god. The product of the ceremony would be another device, this one very simple: a crystal octahedron, which could be spun like a child’s top. It is the Top of Aten, a thing of as great magical power as the device which produced it was a wonder of natural science.

By bringing the Top of Aten “farthest south” to the “last city of the oldest beings,” and then summoning their god, the cult intended to use their cosmic gyro to alter the rotational axis of the Earth, thereby bringing a strange land (surely Antarctica) once more to life. In the process, the annoying “lands of the stick folk”—literally, the lands of men—would be destroyed.

But the ship carrying the device to Egypt was lost in a great storm, and then Ephegon died. The ceremony was never begun.

You’ll recall the mysteries surrounding the Miskatonic expedition to Antarctica, and its tragic outcome; and you know that the Starkweather-Moore expedition leaves Bremen this winter to return to Antarctica and reopen the terrible questions which Lake first raised. But have you heard of the Karpathos Device—the strange instrument recovered near the island of Karpathos? After examining it, I knew that this was Ephegon’s device!

Louis, it is my firm conviction that this tale is true, that a great scheme to change the world has been reactivated by the cult of Aten. Perhaps they employed great magic to manipulate destiny, or perhaps they are exceedingly cunning and evaluate every event for what they may gain of it, but their hour has come round again.

Others also believe this. An erudite and cruel man named Stanford has lent me subtle aid, but says that for arcane reasons he may do no more: he is not a friend, but says that in this thing he serves his god! A kinder, gentler Greek gentleman has also helped. Both seem to represent greater powers than man, perhaps beyond our ken.

But the cult of Aten is strong. At least one among them is no man at all, but a …

Here the letter ends. There is no second sheet. There is nothing on the reverse of the sheet.

As you struggle to digest and evaluate the letter, the guard casually informs you that nothing else of Gliere’s is now at the prison.

choices.text: Go to any New York Location

554.description: Your ship, the USS Rochester, lies snugly at anchor. Ordinarily, as the dashing Lt. Devon Wilson, you’d be storming the gangplank to start your month’s leave with a spree, but Nora’s alarming telegrams abruptly stopped exactly seven days ago, while you were still at sea. You must find her. You study her photo in its Deco frame and then carefully pack it. You’d give everything you have to get her back. As you pack, a chill runs down your spine: Gliere was a suicide, Grunewald and Holt mysteriously lost, and now Nora! You decide to include your service revolver in your bags, and you resolve to equip yourself for any eventuality at that nearby store. The Rochester is in the port location you wish; choose from: New York, Athens, Alexandria, or Bremen. Pick up any equipment or supplies you want and then go to any location below.
554.title: USS Rochester

561.description: You stand before the western face of the pyramid, where the weathered stone hints at secrets long buried beneath the desert sands. With time and perhaps a helpful map, you may uncover something hidden.

574.description:
You have failed! Depending where you are, your experiences vary. Coastline lines suffer dramatic flooding and panic ensues. Scientists claim the Earth has somehow shifted on its axis and that terrible consequences will follow. Indeed, they do. Storms of primeval force sweep the continents. Melting polar ice fuels the flooding, while terrifying ice storms strike at the heart of civilization. Once it begins, much of the world of humankind is destroyed within days. The City of the Old Ones has a new master, and the whole world pays for your failure. Your revolver has a bullet in the chamber. Whether you choose to use it or not, it is ...

THE END.

579.description: A chance flirtation leads you to the ship’s casino. You find yourself at the baccarat table, and luck is on your side. You win $87!

effects.message: You don't remember much about last night, but what you do makes you grin.

581.description: They’re playing a form of whist. You hope to get information, but your winning streak quickly becomes phenomenal. Soon the fishermen grumble to themselves and stir unhappily. In 20 minutes you clean out the table. You win a total of $35, and stuff your pockets with small-denomination drachma notes.

582.description: The amulet is a magic item that summons Nodens, an Elder God, who will carry you anywhere you wish once. After one use, the amulet disappears. You feel a deep connection to this otherworldly force, but also a heavy responsibility as you wield this power.

addItem.name: Black Amulet of Klaath
addItem.description: A strange black amulet, rumored to summon Nodens, an Elder God, who can teleport you once to any location of your choosing.

583.title: HOTEL
583.description: What a find! This hotel is cheap, roomy, warm, spacious, comfortable, and clean.

choices.text: Get a room for the night

584.description: You are served an overpriced, skimpy, smelly, bad-tasting meal!

585.title: HOSPITAL
585.description: You get tender loving care at the hospital.

choices.text: Make a Luck roll for recovery

success.message: Your recovery is swift and effective. You gain several hit points for the first day.

failure.message: Recovery is slow, but you still gain a few hit points for the first day.

586.description: Small fast-food stands occur in every city: hot dogs, falafel, and so on.

1.description: That food really hit the spot!

2-10.description: The food tasted all right at the time, but now your stomach is churning.

587.description: It has you! The bubbling thing envelops you and rips you into shreds—as if you were nothing more than tissue paper. You have been consumed! It is ... THE END.

588.description: The river is very strong, with much debris floating in it, and many crocodiles! You decide to go back to the village.

589.description: You follow the tire tracks across the sands. A strong south wind begins to blow.

590.description: The purser tells you that skeet shooting from the fantail will soon begin.

593.description: A small diner offering basic meals. It's a place to sit down and have a meal while gathering your thoughts.
593.title: BEE'S DINER

594.description: You are able to climb down the fire escape, and make your way to another nearby hotel. You are safe for the night.

7a.description: You realize that you have no idea where Gliere's room is. You go upstairs. All the doors are closed; none have names on them.

10a.title: Quick Response
10a.description: You react swiftly, getting your weapon ready before the stranger can fully attack.

10b.title: Caught Off Guard
10b.description: You fail to react in time. The man strikes first with his knife, aiming a deadly blow.

10c.title: Knife Wound
10c.description: The knife pierces through, wounding you severely. You must continue fighting for your life.

10d.title: Combat Continues
10d.description: The battle rages on. Either party must fight until one can no longer continue.

failure.message: The stranger lets loose a shot as you fail to dodge.

10e.description: You were able to defeat the enemy.

10f.description: You slipped away from the enemy.

11b.description: Before you enter, you sense something beyond the door. You put your ear to the door, but are startled by someone behind you!

27a.description: A second thing grabs you. Their combined strength is overwhelming. Make an opposed roll against a combined STR of 140.

choices.text: Make an opposed STR roll against 140

success.message: You squirm free and escape.

failure.message: A third figure grips you tightly, and you are unable to break free.

27b.description:
A third one grips you, and all three begin tearing at your flesh. You scream as the figures overwhelm you.

It is ... THE END.

28a.description: You've managed to enter the Harding House without causing too much disturbance. Now, you must navigate quietly.

choices.text: Attempt Stealth to scout the house

44b.title: Combat Continues
44b.description: The battle with the undead Arab begins! He is attacking the co-pilot, but he will only be distracted for so long before he starts attacking you. You must stop him before he kills the pilot!

44c.description: You successfully defeated the Arab. The co-pilot is safe for now. You need to take control of the plane or find help.

choices.text: Try to fly the plane yourself
Try to help the co-pilot with First Aid

44d.description: The Arab kills the co-pilot, and overpowers you. The plane crashes, and all aboard are killed.

44e.description: The co-pilot's injuries are too grave for you to save him. You look up just in time to see the ground approaching quickly. The plane crashes and everyone aboard dies.

44f.description: You failed to take control of the plane in time. It crashes and everyone aboard dies.

47b.description: You are exhausted and cannot continue without rest.

choices.text: Get some rest and wake up tomorrow morning

73a.description: The ship is huge, but nothing strikes you as out of the ordinary.

77a.description: 'Gliere hung himself, he killed himself. Yes, his body has been shipped to the United States. The Professor left nothing behind to be recovered.'

83a.description: You ask about the foreign pari seen on deck, but no one seems to know what you are talking about.

94_survival_check.description: If you succeed with a Survival (Desert) roll, you can ration your water supply.

success.message: You ration the water well and extend your supply.

failure.message: You struggle to ration your water.

94_walk.description: The heat is incredible, but you must go on. Roll to determine where you go next.

5-9.description: Maybe there is some way you can orient yourself better.

97a.description: You notice the slinky sound or smell the reptilian odor of asps. They are slithering on the floor, and two seem to be under the bedclothes! In moments, they’ll be at your head.

choices.text: Jump to the door of your room

97b.description: You dream of walking through a field when you are startled to see a snake in the grass. You wake up with a start, only to realize that snakes are slithering under the sheets of your bed!

choices.text: Jump to the door of your room

98a.description: You lose control of the plane as it climbs, the nose dips suddenly, and despite your efforts, you crash into the ground. The world goes black as the plane explodes in flames. This is the end of your journey.

98b.description: You manage to keep the plane steady and continue flying through the skies. Now, make a successful Navigate roll to reach Cairo Airport. Fail the roll and you land somewhere else.

105a.description: Christos leans in and whispers to you about what he overheard from the sailors. They were talking about some kind of curse, which they say is leaving Greece. Christos also mentions that the Kyonas, an ocean-going motorship, is for hire.

106a.title: Combat Continues
106a.description: The battle rages on. Either party must fight until one can no longer continue.

failure.message: The stranger lets loose a shot as you fail to dodge.

107a.description: Christos whispers to you, "They say Gliere was strangled." Suddenly, the men stop talking and look up at you.

112a.description: You realize Hawkes’ library is stocked with a strange assortment of titles: "Marvels of the Spirit World", Crowley’s "Incantations", Weinburger’s "Die Mond".

choices.text: You shudder as you feel a chill run down your spine

112b.description: You see that the stout chair in the center of the room has odd, regular notches and grooves in its arms, legs, and back.

choices.text: You feel a chill run down your spine

112c.description: You hear some deep breathing behind a nearby curtain.

choices.text: Is someone hidden behind the curtain?

112d.description: That terrible feeling of dread is growing.

112e.description: That terrible feeling of dread is growing, but you are already aware of the danger.

112f.description: From behind the curtain, a hand suddenly reaches out for you. You must act quickly.

success.message: You slip beneath the hand and make a break for the door.

112g.description:
The heavy breather grabs you and shoves you into the chair, the one with the odd grooves and notches. You hear the sharp sound of releasing springs, and metal bands wrap around your arms and legs, holding you tight to the chair. There is nothing you can do!

How foolish you were to have trusted a strange man you’ve only just met.

Now the heavy breather steps around so that you can see him clearly. You see dry, leathery skin, portions of which flake away as he moves. The eyes are hollow, inhuman. Hawkes sniggers, and introduces you to Achmed, who Hawkes says is nearly 3,000 years old, and who is very, very hungry. You are wild-eyed, and the sound of Hawkes’ maniacal laughter screams in your ears. Achmed’s mouth opens slowly, and he leans toward your helpless body. You see that his teeth are long, yellow, and very sharp. Your screams fill the room, but no one comes to save you. It is...

THE END.

123b.description: They are at your door and you hear the door rattle slightly. You must decide what to do next.

success.message: You hear footsteps outside your door.

failure.message: You fail to notice anything unusual.

choices.message: Very sensible! You see a fire escape leading down to safety.
You lock the door. As you step away, you see it unlock and door starts to open.
You hide in the bathroom, hoping to remain undetected. You hear the door open in the other room, footsteps approaching the bathroom door, then the bathroom door swings open.
You crawl under the bed, hoping the strangers don't find you. You hear the door open.
The door starts to open and you shout for them to leave your room. There is laughter on the other side of the door.

You ready your weapon, prepared for anything as the door opens. Two figures enter, a short man holding a wicked-looking dagger and a tall man dressed in a shadowy cloak. The short man comes at you, ready to strike.

129a.description: You try to scream for help. Someone might hear you, but time is running out.

choices.text: Make a Luck roll to summon help

success.message: Help arrives! A doctor and the conductor come running in. The conductor beats the snakes to death while the doctor tends to you, extracting the poison. It takes some time, but you are finally able to get some rest. You reach Cairo (without further incident) several days later.

129b.description: No one hears your screams. The poison is spreading, and your body is weakening. You must try to resist the effects.

success.message: You feel like you are fighting off the poison.

failure.message: The poison surges through your body.

135a.description: You notice a small Egyptian fellow lurking ahead of you. You may have seen him before. He holds something in his hand shiny in his hand. You are down a side passage now and have quickened your pace. Now you hear his footsteps scurry after you. Is it only your imagination, or are the corridor lights dimming?

success.message: You successfully reach the deck and the safety of the promenade. You are ready to call it a day and get some rest.

failure.message: You take a wrong turn and find yourself at a locked hatch labeled 'No Admittance.'

137b.description: Just as you become aware of people behind you, two massive, leathery hands clamp around your neck like a vise and start to strangle you.

choices.text: Try to break free with a Hard Strength roll

success.message: You succeed in breaking free and run out of the theater to safety.

failure.message: You have been murdered...

137c.description:
You have failed all your attempts to escape. As the strangulation intensifies, your vision fades...

THE END.

141b.description: You hear thunderous snores. This room is occupied and can’t be Gliere’s room; you better try a different door. Uh oh! Someone's coming!

150b.title: Professorial Study
150b.description: You enter and cautiously turn on a light to see a room in proper professorial confusion. Scattered about are books of myths and fables, and there are bundles of clippings from various foreign newspapers. You hear shuffling behind you!

154a.description: You try to get some shut eye.

choices.text: Spend the night, then explore Cairo
Spend the night, then explore Alexandria

155a.description: You draw your weapon and prepare to fight. Make a DEX roll to attack first.

success.message: You manage to hit the short man and take 1D6 damage.

failure.message: You miss and the short man hits you.

155b.description: The short man stabs you with his dagger. You must fight or dodge to survive.

success.message: You dodge the blow and try to escape.

failure.message: The stranger lets loose a shot as you fail to dodge.

155c.description: The short man falls, but the tall hooded figure blocks the exit. As you launch a desperate series of attacks to make your escape, you see your blows (knife, bullets, etc.) go through him into the bulkheads, as if he were a ghost! His inhuman glowing eyes are now visible within the gloom of the cowl, and you feel a deathly chill in the air.

success.message: You manage to keep your sanity and attempt to escape.

155d.description: His hands reach out towards you!

success.message: You narrowly escape the horrifying figure.

155e.description: The tall figure’s hands close around your throat, and you feel a cold, clammy grip on your soul. You are dead.

159_fail.description: You failed the Spot Hidden roll. You can continue looking through the Occult books, or return to the New York Public Library.

choices.text: Continue looking over the Occult books
Return to the New York Public Library

177a.description: You swagger over and grill the Museum Director. He tries to put you off, saying he doesn’t know why Gliere stole the Device.

success.message: You detect something is off about his answer regarding Gliere.

failure.message: You can't tell if he's lying.

success.message: You sense he's hiding something about the loan.

failure.message: You believe what he says about the loan.

177c.description: You inquire further about the claim that the Karpathos Device is just a clock.

success.message: You can tell he's being untruthful about the device being a clock.

failure.message: You believe the Karpathos Device is just a clock.

185a.description: You have your weapon ready. The short man lunges at you with his dagger. You must defend yourself or fight back.

success.message: You successfully dodge the short man's attack.

failure.message: The short man's dagger finds its mark, injuring you.

185b.description: You must act quickly to defend yourself.

success.message: You successfully dodge the attack.

failure.message: The short man's dagger finds its mark, injuring you.

185c.description: You manage to wound the short man, and he collapses unconscious from the damage. As you look around, the tall man in the cloak blocks the exit, his eyes glowing ominously. The air grows deathly cold.

185d.description: You evade the short man, and you still have a chance to survive. The tall man is blocking the exit. His eyes glow in the shadow of his cloak.

185e.description: The tall man seems inhuman, his glowing eyes locked on you. You feel a deathly chill emanating from him. You must make a decision quickly.

success.message: Your attack passes through the figure, and you lose your footing! You stumble forward and pass completely through the being, as if he were a ghost! You clamber out of the door and run out of the hotel.

failure.message: Your desperate attack has no effect, passing through the figure as if he were a ghost! The figure moves closer.

success.message: You dodge the figure and manage to escape!

failure.message: You fail to dodge, and the figure grabs you.

185g.description:
The hooded figure grabs you with cold, inhuman hands, and the life drains out of you as you struggle in vain. For you, this is...

THE END.

191b.description: Looking into the mirror, you see a horrible creature staring back at you. You jump back, but you can’t move fast enough before a terrifying, hound-like creature manifests from the corner of the room.

191c.description:
The Hound of Tindalos overwhelms you with its brutal strength and relentless attacks. Its savage bite tears into your flesh, smearing your body with the foul bluish ichor that pulses through its otherworldly form. The ichor, alive and insidious, begins to consume you, burning and gnawing at your skin with searing agony.

As you struggle in vain to wipe it away, the hound's long, lashing tongue strikes next, puncturing your body, leaving a deep penetrating hole. Though bloodless and painless, the wound drains your very essence, robbing you of your soul’s power. You fall to the ground, defeated by the alien terror from beyond time, as the ichor devours you and your spirit fades.

191d.description: Its eyes burn with an alien intensity, and its pulsating blue-tinged skin emits a dread chill. You may not know what this creature is, but its razor-sharp teeth and claws, and the way it materialized through the angles of time, tell you all you need to know: it is a Hound of Tindalos.

choices.text: Engage in combat with the Hound of Tindalos

191e.description: The hound is upon you now, and there is no escape.

choices.text: Get a good night’s rest and explore Cairo
Get a good night’s rest and explore Alexandria

215b.description:
The museum closes at 9:00 PM.

There is more to be found here in the library! Spend another hour to attempt another Library Use roll.

choices.text: Attempt another Library Use roll (for deeper insights)

failure.message: You find nothing additional, but you can try again.

choices.text: Return to the university main entry

222b.description: You fail to evade the attacker, and he swings his blade at you. You must now fight to survive!

failure.message: You fail to evade the attacker, and he swings his blade at you. You must now fight to survive!

6.description: The first guard attempts to grab you.

1-5.description: The first guard shoots at you, causing damage.

230_guard_1_combat.description: The first guard has grabbed you! Fight back with the Karpathos Device or try to dodge.

230_guard_2_action.description: Now, you face the second guard.

6.description: The second guard attempts to grab you.

1-5.description: The second guard shoots at you, causing damage.

230_guard_2_combat.description: The second guard has grabbed you! Decide your next move.

230_guard_3_action.description: You now confront the third and final guard.

6.description: The third guard tries to grab you.

1-5.description: The third guard shoots, causing damage, but you escape his pursuit!

230_guard_3_combat.description: The final guard has made his move to grab you. How will you respond?

choices.text: Use the Karpathos Device to fight

230a.description: The glass shatters loudly as you grab the Karpathos Device. It is surprisingly heavy. Unfortunately, the noise attracts immediate attention. Make a DEX check to see if you can escape before the guard unstraps his revolver and takes a shot at you.

choices.text: Attempt to escape with the Device, make a DEX check

230b.description: You sprint through the halls, evading the guard. As you turn a corner, you face the first of three more guards stationed in successive rooms.

230c.description: The guard fires his revolver. If you survive, you must still try to escape through the museum.

choices.text: Continue to flee despite the injury.

230d.description: You are now facing the first guard. Roll to determine the guard's action.

230e.description: After dealing with the first guard, you now face the second guard.

230f.description: Having navigated past the second guard, you now face the third and final guard.

239b.description:
Professor Khargeh leans in, lowering his voice. "Some texts are not meant for human understanding," he says. "Certain ancient symbols, when read aloud, can affect the mind. One passage from a tablet we found near Thebes caused a researcher to lose sleep for weeks. The script seemed to twist before his eyes as if it were alive. Even I have seen things I cannot explain after reading certain words." He gives a nervous smile. "But of course, that’s just superstition."

You feel a shiver, and a slight unease settles in your mind.

choices.text: Return to the university main entry

241a.description: Your cat-like grace means you have evaded him and run away. You spend the night unmolested in the hotel. In the morning, you decide to head for Cairo.

249a.description: The authorities are hot on your trail, your fate hangs in the balance.

choices.text: Resist arrest and try to escape.
Attempt to destroy the Karpathos Device.

249b.description: You find that the Device is impervious to your hasty assaults. But the Nile is only a few paces distant. You consider whether to throw it into the river to prevent its misuse.

choices.text: Throw the Device into the Nile.
Reconsider and surrender to the police.

249c.description:
You steal a felucca and slowly drift downstream. Sometime later you judge it safe, and drop the heavy Device into the Nile itself, so that it will sink down into the deep silts that have lain there undisturbed for millennia. Later, the police find you and capture you. You serve seven years in an Egyptian prison, only to return home penniless, disgraced, and without home or friends. Your life is ruined, and until you die you never know whether you did the right thing in Cairo all those years before. But you did, of course. Well done! You saved the world.

THE END.

249d.description: It doesn't take long for the police to surround you and reclaim the Karpathos Device. As for you, the police arrest you and you spend several years in prison, before being released and returned to America.

256a.description: You find a tiny puddle of water; it does not make you sick when you drink it. You don’t need to consume your own water supply this day—you have an extra day of life.

success.message: You top a rise and see Alexandria in the distance. That evening you’re in its streets.

failure.message: You failed the Luck roll.

256b.description: You find a tiny puddle of water; it does not make you sick when you drink it. You don’t need to consume your own water supply this day—you have an extra day of life.

success.message: You top a rise and see Alexandria in the distance. That evening you’re in its streets.

failure.message: You failed the Luck roll.

263a.description: You focus intently, trying to spot a safe path through the menacing shadows.

failure.message: A mummy's hand brushes against you as you fail to notice a crucial detail!

263b.description: Having spotted a possible path, you now need to dodge the groping hands of the undead.

failure.message: You stumble as a hand clutches at your foot, causing minor injuries!

263c.description: One last challenge: apply your intellect to find the safest exit route.

success.message: You hurl yourself through a plate glass window to escape, suffering cuts in the process.

failure.message: A wrong turn! You're swiped by a clawed appendage as you miscalculate your route.

286b.description: Jahark says softly, "That ring is powerful. Whether it can help, I do not know." The ring is heavy with gold, covered with signs, most prominently a five-pointed star with a core of flame. It has power, particularly against dead things brought back to existence.

287b.description: The map is a flattened view of the pyramid at Tell-el-Amarna.

297b.description: "I’m sure that this passage refers to it, ‘A cursed key for a cursed box! The Top of Terror, it unlocks.’"

299_end.description: You must hope that a wiser, better-skilled investigator takes up the chase. As for you, it is ... THE END.

299_survival_check.description: Make a Survival (Desert) roll. If successful, you can choose a direction. If you fail, it's the end of your journey.

success.message: You survive and must choose a direction.

failure.message: You are doomed.

299_survival_direction.description: You survive and must choose a direction.

success.message: Your inner strength guides you.

failure.message: Your eyesight suddenly blurs. You must now rely on your survival skills.

305b.description: If you successfully make a Spot Hidden check, you may discover something important.

failure.message: You find nothing of interest.

321a.description:
You wake up on the morning of the second day of the trip, and there’s no one in sight. You have been completely abandoned by your guide. You breathe a sigh of relief, though, as before he drove off in the car, he thoughtfully unloaded any gear belonging to you.

To reach safety you either can swim the Nile in high flood, or you can follow the car tracks back to that little village not too far away.

choices.text: Swim the Nile in high flood
Follow the car tracks to the village

348b.description: It stares at you, a basket in its hand, leering crazily. You finally understand that it is just waiting.

353b.description:
