In section-K, a shaft leads down, with handholds carved into the wall.

You can attempt to navigate it with an INT roll.

371b.description: You manage to hold on. Now, make a Climb roll to get back to the previous section.

failure.message: You lose your grip and fall to the bottom.

373_amulet_check.description: If you have the amulet of Nodens, you may use it now to escape.

choices.text: Use the amulet to return to Tell-el-Amarna
Use the amulet to return to Cairo

373_fill_basket.description: Yes, fill it, your mind shrieks. Fill it with bits and pieces from all the bodies down here, some of them still moving. You continue to fill the basket until you are driven insane. When you go insane, you become part of the grisly, half-dead pile. This is ... THE END.

373a.description: You manage to keep your composure, but the situation is unnerving.

373b.description: Your mind reels at the sight of the blood and movement around you.

373c.description: If you climbed down here, your rope falls and lands beside you. You are trapped. If you were thrown here, you’re trapped.

choices.text: Do you have the amulet of Nodens?

373d.description: You hear another sound from above. In the gloom, you see a basket being lowered. A whispery, otherworldly voice croaks, 'Fill the basket!'

373e.description: Acid rains down upon you, burning your skin. The voice calls again, 'Fill the basket!'

375b.title: Combat Continues
375b.description: The shopkeeper lunges at you with his knife, screaming in an almost feral manner. You must defend yourself or try to escape!

choices.text: Use a weapon to fight back

375c.description: The shopkeeper's attack overwhelms you. His knife strikes deep, and you collapse to the floor, bleeding. The marketplace fades from view as darkness takes you.

398b.description:
You’re in section-N, by some miracle.

Stairs lead down to another section, or you can try climbing back up to the corridor.

choices.text: Attempt to Climb back up the rope

402-combat-round.description: The fight rages on. You must either keep attacking or try to dodge the creature’s relentless strikes.

success.message: You successfully dodge the creature's attack and escape.

failure.message: You fail to dodge, and the creature strikes you hard.

402-combat-start.description: The creature stands before you, ready to attack. You must fight for your life!

choices.text: Engage in combat with the ghast

402-player-defeated.description: The creature overwhelms you with its strength, and you fall to the ground, defeated.

403b.description: You failed to move the wall. You can either wait to try again or return to 438.

choices.text: Go back the way you came

405-captured.description: You’re held firm by their moldering hands. The mummies drag you back to the man, who again transforms himself back into the bubbling fleshy mass—a shoggoth! You scream as the shoggoth expands and envelops you, ripping you into pieces. Needless to say, it is... THE END.

405-dynamite-fail.description: The dynamite goes off, but the monsters emerge from the debris. You now have several mummies chasing you. You must fight or dodge them to escape.

success.message: You successfully fend off the mummies and make your way out.

failure.message: You fail to fight the mummies.

405-dynamite-success.description: The ceiling collapses, sealing the chamber along with the horrors within. You escape, feeling a sense of relief as you leave the scene behind.

405-fail-sanity.description: You retreat screaming as the horrors of the chamber overwhelm your mind.

choices.text: Use dynamite to seal the chamber
Run for your life back to the entrance of the pyramid

405-luck-check.description: You failed to escape the mummies, but fortune may still favor you. Make a Luck roll to see if you manage to slip away.

success.message: By sheer luck, you manage to evade the mummies and escape.

failure.message: Your luck runs out.

405-success.description: You remain silent, holding on to your composure.

choices.text: Use dynamite to seal the chamber
Retreat hurriedly back to the entrance of the pyramid

405-throw-dynamite.description: You prepare to throw the dynamite and attempt to seal the chamber.

success.message: The dynamite hits its mark, causing the ceiling to collapse, sealing the chamber.

405b.description:
The short man speaks, and you understand his intentions: "The hour has arrived, my Master. Now your kingdom shall be greater than Mu, greater than Atlantis, and and we … We shall be with you, not as mere servants but as lords." The man turns and faces the wall.

Then you see the Karpathos Device, gleaming in the subdued light. The man touches the wall, and an opening appears, as dark as the pit to hell. The man inserts the Device, and the whole wall seems to part. A shaft of prismatic light arcs into the room, swirling around everyone. The man screams, and you see a glistening silver top appear, hovering in the air. As the top waits there, the man shakes and quivers with extraordinary violence. His flesh seems to melt from his bones until he becomes a horrifying mass of pulsating material. A sickening foul odor fills the room, while you hear mental messages again:

"Into the pit! The icy pit where the Old Ones lie!"
"Into the pit! And once more all life must die!"
"Where all is north, He will come forth."
"The top will spin, the Lord will grin!"
"Into the pit! Into the pit! Into the pit!"

The top is taken by the pulsating mass. The fleshy mass then begins to reform itself into a man, but a different, taller one. You can’t make him out. You do perceive that the top is to be taken somewhere, but now all you can understand is "Starkweather-Moore."

choices.text: Make a Sanity roll for the transformation

412-end.description: You’re held firm by their moldering hands. The mummies begin pulling you apart! Yes, it is ... THE END.

choices.text: Attempt to fight or dodge the mummies

success.message: You successfully fend off or dodge the mummies and make your way out.

failure.message: You fail to fight or dodge the mummies.

412-luck-roll.description: You failed to escape the mummies, but you may still have a chance. Make a Luck roll to see if you can slip away.

success.message: By sheer luck, you manage to evade the mummies and escape.

failure.message: Your luck runs out.

412-stealth.description: You must now attempt to sneak away from the chamber. If you fail, you risk alerting the mummies and ghasts.

choices.text: Use dynamite to seal the chamber

success.message: You successfully sneak away and escape the pyramid.

failure.message: You make a tiny mistake by dislodging a pebble.

412b.description: The Karpathos Device is in the wall, and above it you see what looks like a chamber in the wall. The chamber is open, and empty. A circular bas-relief fills the upper walls, on which is a strange city, and odd stalk-like creatures walking oddly angled streets. Then, in the next section, the stalk-creatures are trapped by falling snow and ice. Ultimately, the whole city and its occupants are buried under miles of ice. The last part of the mosaic shows a glistening silver top, shaped like an octahedron, and a world globe—but the globe’s tilt seems somehow wrong.

success.message: You hold your composure despite the outlandish scene.

failure.message: You lose control slightly but remain focused.

414b.description: The crowd groans. You walk away with nothing, slightly embarrassed by your loss.

422-climb.description: You stare up the incline, knowing that climbing is your only escape.

success.message: You successfully climb to safety and escape the horrors below.

failure.message: You fail to climb in time.

422-end.description: They pull at your skin, and you hear the horrifying sound of your own flesh tearing. The last thing you see is an open mouth leering down at you, as you scream for blessed unconsciousness. It is … THE END.

425-discard-mirror.description: You manage to discard the cursed mirror safely. Shaken but alive, you leave it behind and return to the previous section, avoiding any further contact with shiny objects.

425-fail-sanity.description: You drop the mirror, overwhelmed by the terrifying vision, and retreat to the previous section. You spend a considerable amount of time recovering from the shock.

425-pow-check.description: Having maintained your composure, you must now make a POW roll. Each failure will cause a permanent loss of 10 DEX points.

success.message: You manage to resist the mirror's influence, for now.

failure.message: You feel your body slow down as you lose 10 DEX points.

425-pow-fail.description: You can try to discard the mirror.

choices.text: Did you read about an artifact like this once?

success.message: Yes! There was definitely a book you remember reading about an artifact like this. You close your eyes and gently place the mirror down on the ground. You manage to discard the mirror safely and escape the horror.

failure.message: You fail to discard the mirror, and must continue holding it.

success.message: Yes! There was definitely a book you remember reading about an artifact like this. You close your eyes and gently place the mirror down on the ground. You manage to discard the mirror safely and escape the horror.

failure.message: You fail to discard the mirror, and must continue holding it.

1-50.description: A creature suddenly emerges from the shadows, ready to attack!

51-100.description: You manage to leave the crypt safely, unmolested.

430-combat-round.description: You must keep attacking or attempt to dodge the ghast's attacks.

success.message: You successfully dodge the ghast's attack and are ready for the next round.

failure.message: You fail to dodge, and the ghast strikes you hard. You are thrown down the shaft!

430-ghast-defeated.description: You have inflicted enough damage to defeat the ghast. It flees into the shadows, leaving you victorious. You scramble back up the limestone wall, finding yourself at the bottom of some stairs.

430-investigator-defeated.description: The ghast pushes you into the shaft.

430b.description: You must fend off the ghast.

choices.text: Engage in combat with the ghast

439b.description: As you are sliding, you get an idea. You quickly pull out a knife and plunge it into the limestone.

success.message: You avoided breaking your knife.

failure.message: Your knife breaks. You must continue east unless you have another knife.

441_west.description:
You’re in section-M.

You can head West up the stairs, or try to jump over the shaft.

success.message: You succeed in the Jump roll.

failure.message: You don't quite make the jump.

443b.description: You made it down safely. On the way, you can attempt one of the following skill rolls:

446-str1.description: You failed to dodge the worms. Now, you must make a STR roll to break free.

success.message: You break free from the worms and escape.

failure.message: The mass of worms grows, and you are held fast.

446-str2.description: The growing mass of worms cover you almost completely. You must make another STR roll, but this time with a penalty die. If you fail again, the situation worsens.

choices.text: Attempt a STR roll with one penalty die

success.message: You manage to break free from the worms and escape.

failure.message: The worms tighten their hold on you even more.

446-str3.description: You are now almost completely consumed by the mass of worms. You must make one final STR roll, but with two penalty dice. Failure here means your doom.

choices.text: Attempt a final STR roll with two penalty dice

success.message: You break free at the last moment and escape the worms.

failure.message: The worms overwhelm you, and you are consumed.

456a.description: You hid in the Lifeboat. The lifeboat is checked once during the voyage. Roll your Stealth to avoid being discovered.

456b.description: You hid in the Cargo Hold. Roll your Stealth to avoid being discovered.

456c.description: You hid in the Lower Deck. You must convince the crew not to betray you to the Captain. Choose either Charm or Fast Talk to attempt.

456d.description: You hid in the Engine Room (Rear). You must make friends with the two wipers who tend the second engine. Choose either Charm or Psychology to attempt.

461b.title: BREMEN MISSION HOUSE
461b.description: You find a room at the Bremen Mission House. The night is quiet, and you sleep well. In the morning, you are refreshed and ready to face the day.

481a.description: Your gun is handy. You take a shot at point-blank range.

failure.message: You miss the shot and must try to escape.

481b.description: Fortunately, the police arrive and break up the fight. You are arrested and remain in jail for 10 days before bail from abroad arrives to free you.

484b.description: They grab you and begin to pummel you. Fortunately, they decide not to use their knife and eventually the police arrive, arresting everyone. You are jailed for 10 days before bail arrives to free you.

488a.description: "Right ... just what we need ... another professor. If Blake vouches for you, welcome aboard."

488b.description: He says "Sorry, no reporters, especially ladies," he mutters.

choices.text: Are you going to take that?

497a.description:
Blake is happy to see you. He welcomes you warmly and shares some details about the expedition.

The trip is to retrace the ill-fated journey of the Lake expedition. He attributes stories of lost cities to “Dementia Antarctica.”

497b.description: Blake talks with some reluctance. He explains that the trip is to retrace the ill-fated journey of the Lake expedition. He dismisses stories of lost cities as 'Dementia Antarctica.'

582b.description: You can use the amulet to teleport to any one of the following locations:

585_exit.description: You decide it's time to leave the hospital. Where to next?

585a.description: You feel much better but can still recover more.

choices.text: Stay another day to regain 1 hit point (up to your normal maximum)

585b.description: Your condition is stable, but additional rest could help.

choices.text: Stay another day to regain 1 hit point (up to your normal maximum)
